trans-unit.source: Configures an <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlersSection"></xref> configuration section.
This class cannot be inherited.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction> class provides a way to programmatically access and modify the `add` element of the `httpHandlers` configuration section.
This type is part of a group that includes the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerActionCollection> and the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlersSection> types.

The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction> can read and write information from and to the related section of the configuration file according to the section property <xref:System.Configuration.SectionInformation.AllowDefinition%2A> whose value is <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationAllowDefinition.Everywhere>.
ASP.NET searches for the handler assembly DLL in the application's private \bin directory first, and then it searches in the system assembly cache.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction"></xref> class using the passed parameters.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction.%23ctor%2A> constructor is not intended to be used directly from your code.
It is called by the ASP.NET configuration system.
You obtain an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction> class by using the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlersSection.Handlers%2A> property.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction"></xref> URL path.
A comma-separated class/assembly combination consisting of version, culture, and public-key tokens.
A comma-separated list of HTTP verbs (for example, "GET, PUT, POST").
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction"></xref> class using the passed parameters.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction.%23ctor%2A> constructor is not intended to be used directly from your code.
It is called by the ASP.NET configuration system.
You obtain an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction> class by using the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlersSection.Handlers%2A> property.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction"></xref> URL path.
A comma-separated class/assembly combination consisting of version, culture, and public-key tokens.
A comma-separated list of HTTP verbs (for example, "GET, PUT, POST").
`true` to allow validation; otherwise, `false`.
If `false`, ASP.NET will not attempt to load the class until the actual matching request comes, potentially delaying the error but improving the startup time.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction"></xref> path.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction.Path%2A> property can contain either a single URL or a wildcard string.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction"></xref> URL path.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction"></xref> type.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction.Type%2A> property is a comma-separated class/assembly combination consisting of version, culture, and public-key tokens.
ASP.NET searches for the handler assembly DLL in the application's private \bin directory first, and then it searches in the system assembly cache.
The <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction"></xref> type.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction"></xref> validation.

If the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction.Validate%2A> property is `false`, ASP.NET will not attempt to load the class until the actual matching request comes, potentially delaying the error but improving the startup time.
`true` if the validation is allowed; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the verb allowed by the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction"></xref> object.
This <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction.Verb%2A> property can be a comma-separated list of HTTP verbs (for example, "GET, PUT, POST").
The verb allowed by the object.
